"WELCOME HOME"

# BITSY VERSION 2.1

! ROOM_FORMAT 1

POS 2 11,11

DLG 10
Your brother's silver crown is tarnished and dented. He won't look you in the eyes.

DLG a
"Ho, brother. Our father awaits."

DLG b
"It's been a long time, brother. I'm glad to see you yet live."

DLG f
"After everything, you dare to return home...? I'll be honest. I'm impressed."

DLG e
"Our father wishes to speak with you, brother."

DLG o
Your newest brother spins idly by. His eyes are still skinned over, but you can see the natal pupils roving beneath, like tadpoles.

DLG p
A fetal sibling coalesces in a nest of cloud.

DLG n
CAAW.

DLG m
CAW!

DLG k
"MY DUTY IS NEVERENDING," your father says. His wrinkled head inclines toward the earth, seeking eyelessly for all those mundane mortal wants and pains. This is the burden you've chosen freedom from.

DLG l
"MY SIGHT IS PURE," your father says. The eyeless, mindless husk of his head bobs in the breeze and shares consciousness with the clouds.

DLG g
"YOU'VE RETURNED... DESPITE THE CURSES OF YOUR UNCLES AND YOUR BROTHERS. WE CAN NO LONGER SAY YOU HAVE NO COURAGE."

DLG h
"WHEN I LAST LOOKED INTO YOUR HEART, I KNEW YOU COULD NOT STAY FOREVER WITH BOTH YOUR FEET ON THE HUMBLE EARTH. YOU ARE BORN FOR GREATER THINGS." The air thrums with love, or pride-- or naked smugness, perhaps.

DLG i
"WHAT LURE OR PLEASURE KEEPS YOU WALKING LEADEN ON THE EARTH? IF THERE IS SOME MORTAL FRIVOLITY YOU CANNOT LIVE WITHOUT... I CAN PROVIDE IT," your father says. Pshh. You've heard this promise before.

DLG j
You can hear his hesitation. "...WE TRAIN OUR THOUGHTS ON YOU, FROM TIME TO TIME," he says. "YOU MIGHT HAVE FELT THE PRESSURE OF OUR MINDS." As you suspected. You smile wryly.

DLG z
CAW! CAW!
